steps: Step 1: Assess your current fitness level and identify your strength training goals.
Step 2: Choose a workout split (e.g., full body, upper/lower, push/pull/legs) that fits your schedule.
Step 3: Select compound exercises targeting major muscle groups (e.g., squats, deadlifts, bench press).
Step 4: Plan workout days and rest days, aiming for 3-5 strength training sessions per week.
Step 5: Determine sets, reps, and weights for each exercise, starting with moderate intensity.
Step 6: Include warm-up and cool-down routines in each session.
Step 7: Track your progress and gradually increase weights or reps over the 30 days.
Step 8: Incorporate proper nutrition and hydration to support muscle growth and recovery.
Step 9: Schedule rest or active recovery days to prevent overtraining.
Step 10: Review and adjust the routine at the end of 30 days based on progress and goals.
